column4: Ubuntu isn't able here to automount udf CDs. Any ideas to resolve it?
mount it with a terminal command?
I did it and worked, but then I wasn't able to umount it because it said the device was busy, all the time.
you need to cd away from any directory on the disk before you can umount. Also close all open files on the CD.
I did it, but still got this problem
I get this, sometimes it's just impossible to find the process that prevents umounting. I don't think it's a udf fault.
I don't know. The ISO cds mounts ok, but only when it comes to udf I got this problem
well, I may be wrong. Does umount -f work?
never tried it.
last time I tried it didn't work anyway.
I'll check it now
now I was able to umount, without -f
but automount still doesn't work
are you using a mountpoint under /media ?
yes
/media/cdrom0
maybe mkdir /mnt/udfcd and mount the cd there.
maybe it's nautilus touching the media mountdir.
but I could umount the CD now. I just can't automount. But anyway, I'll try to change the mount point to avoid more problems
well, my suggestion was as a workaround to the umount problem. It cuts out automounting altogether.
yes, yes. At least now I can umount the CD. Thanks for your help o/
